TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit WebException extends System.InvalidOperationException implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when an error occurs while accessing the network through a pluggable protocol.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebException> class is thrown by classes descended from <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> that implement pluggable protocols for accessing the Internet.
When <xref:System.Net.WebException> is thrown by a descendant of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> class, the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property provides the Internet response to the application.
**Associated Tips**
**Check the Response property of the exception to determine why the request failed.** When a <xref:System.Net.WebException> exception is thrown by a descendent of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> class, the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property provides the Internet response to the application.
**Check the Status property of the exception to determine why the request failed.** The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property of the exception provides status information for the error. For more information, see <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus>.
**If you are timing out when stepping into an XML Web Service, set the timeout value for the XML Web Service call to infinite.** For more information, see [Error: Timeout While Debugging Web Services](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4b7df112-788a-4429-9a0c-4c6dac4fb609).

MemberSignature.Value: public WebException ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.WebException> class. The <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message that describes the error. This message takes into account the current system culture. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`. The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
## Examples The following example throws a default <xref:System.Net.WebException>.
[!code-cpp[WebException_Constructor1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Constructor1/CPP/webexception_constructor1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebException_Constructor1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Constructor1/CS/webexception_constructor1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebException_Constructor1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Constructor1/VB/webexception_constructor1.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message`. If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`. The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
## Examples The following example throws a <xref:System.Net.WebException> by specifying an error message.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and nested exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message` and the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property set to the value of `innerException`. If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`. The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
## Examples The following example throws a <xref:System.Net.WebException> by specifying an error message and nested exception.

If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message. A instance that contains the response from the remote host.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message, nested exception, status, and response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message`, the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property set to the value of `innerException`, the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property set to the value of `status`, and the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property set to the value of `response`. If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message.
## Examples The following example throws a <xref:System.Net.WebException> by specifying an error message and a <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus>.
[!code-cpp[WebException_Constructor5#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Constructor5/CPP/webexception_constructor5.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebException_Constructor5#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Constructor5/CS/webexception_constructor5.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebException_Constructor5#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Constructor5/VB/webexception_constructor5.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Net.WebResponse Response { get; }
.property instance class System.Net.WebResponse Response

Docs.summary: Gets the response that the remote host returned.
Docs.value: If a response is available from the Internet resource, a instance that contains the error response from an Internet resource; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Some Internet protocols, such as HTTP, return otherwise valid responses indicating that an error has occurred at the protocol level. When the response to an Internet request indicates an error, <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName> sets the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus?displayProperty=fullName> and provides the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> that contains the error message in the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.WebException> that was thrown. The application can examine the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> to determine the actual error.
## Examples The following example checks the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property and prints to the console the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse.StatusCode%2A> and <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse.StatusDescription%2A> of the underlying <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> instance.
[!code-cpp[WebException_Status_Response#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Status_Response/CPP/webexception_status_response.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebException_Status_Response#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Status_Response/CS/webexception_status_response.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebException_Status_Response#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Status_Response/VB/webexception_status_response.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Net.WebExceptionStatus Status { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Net.WebExceptionStatus Status

Docs.summary: Gets the status of the response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property indicates the reason for the <xref:System.Net.WebException>.
The value of <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> is one of the <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus> values.
> [!WARNING] > The <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ProxyNameResolutionFailure> error is not returned to [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] apps.
## Examples The following example checks the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property and prints to the console the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse.StatusCode%2A> and <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse.StatusDescription%2A> of the underlying <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> instance.
[!code-cpp[WebException_Status_Response#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Status_Response/CPP/webexception_status_response.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebException_Status_Response#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Status_Response/CS/webexception_status_response.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebException_Status_Response#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebException_Status_Response/VB/webexception_status_response.vb#1)]
